page.title: 13BLACKMORE VALE MIXED FARMING
page.content: 0374/0114.Thornhill,a farm of 240 acres, supports 150 Friesians and 300 breeding ewes together with 20 acres of arable land.Silage and hay are also made.The River Lydden forms the boundary for one and a half miles on the south side.One cottage is occupied by a farm hand.The shopping is done mainly in the nearest village of Stalbridge. Home Farm is no longer worked as a farm but is occupied by a builder and his family. Hargrove Farm has 250 acres of pasture land with the River Lydden forming the boundary for one mile. A herd of 150 Friesians are maintained on this farm. The family have their own transport as there is no public transport serving this area.Hargrove Cottage is used as a holiday cottage.
